Sentencas: In most planar solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) stack designs, the interconnect, which is typically made from a ferritic stainless steel (SS), is hermetically sealed to the ceramic positive electrode-electrolyte-negative electrode by a sealing glass.
Titulo: Chemical compatibility of barium-calcium-aluminosilicate-based sealing glasses with the ferritic stainless steel interconnect in SOFCs

Sentencas: To maintain the structural stability and minimize degradation of the stack performance, the sealing glass must be chemically compatible with the SS interconnect.
Titulo: Chemical compatibility of barium-calcium-aluminosilicate-based sealing glasses with the ferritic stainless steel interconnect in SOFCs

Sentencas: In this study, a barium-calcium-aluminosilicate (BCAS)-based glass ceramic, specifically developed as a sealant in SOFC stacks, and a ferritic SS (AISI446) were selected as examples to increase the understanding of the chemical compatibility issues in SOFCs.
Titulo: Chemical compatibility of barium-calcium-aluminosilicate-based sealing glasses with the ferritic stainless steel interconnect in SOFCs

Sentencas: Evaluation of the interfaces of coupon joints indicated that interactions between the BCAS glass ceramic and the ferritic SS were dependent on the exposure conditions.
Titulo: Chemical compatibility of barium-calcium-aluminosilicate-based sealing glasses with the ferritic stainless steel interconnect in SOFCs

Sentencas: At the edges of joints, where oxygen or air was accessible, the interaction often led to the formation of BaCrO4, while in the interior of the joints, chromium or chromia dissolved into the glass to form a thin layer of chromium-rich solid solution.
Titulo: Chemical compatibility of barium-calcium-aluminosilicate-based sealing glasses with the ferritic stainless steel interconnect in SOFCs

Sentencas: It was also found that, in the interior of the joints, the interaction often resulted in the formation of pores aligned along the interface.
Titulo: Chemical compatibility of barium-calcium-aluminosilicate-based sealing glasses with the ferritic stainless steel interconnect in SOFCs

Sentencas: It appears the pore formation along the interface can be avoided through a preheat treatment.
Titulo: Chemical compatibility of barium-calcium-aluminosilicate-based sealing glasses with the ferritic stainless steel interconnect in SOFCs
Chemical compatibility of barium-calcium-aluminosilicate-based sealing glasses with the ferritic stainless steel interconnect in SOFCs
